title: Canyonlands National Park: Sommerville Formation
body: Sommerville Formation        Brown, layered cliffs of the Sommerville Formation along the road to Hans Flat NPS photo by Gary Cox       This layer does not occur within Canyonlands, but may be seen at neighboring Glen Canyon National Recreation Area. Deposited Mid to late Jurassic (144 to 208 million years ago) Depositional Environment Coastal, shallow marine and tidal flats Appearance Sandstone, shale, siltstone and gypsum forms slopes and cliffs Example Exposed along the Green River and in cliffs above the road to Hans Flat Ranger Station in the Maze         Rock Strata   Layer Above: Morrison Formation   Current Layer: Sommerville Formation   Layer Below: Curtis Formation
